data.title: How to Calculate the KL Divergence for Machine Learning
data.description: It is often desirable to quantify the difference between probability distributions for a given random variable. This occurs frequently in machine learning, when we may be interested in calculating the difference between an actual and observed probability distribution. This can be achieved using techniques from information theory, such as the Kullback-Leibler Divergence (KL divergence), or […]

data.title: Video Architecture Search
The FEVER data set: What doesn’t kill it will make it stronger
data.description: This year at the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural-Language Processing (EMNLP), we will cohost the Second Workshop on Fact Extraction and Verification — or FEVER — which will explore techniques for automatically assessing the veracity of factual assertions online.

data.title: Highlights from O'Reilly AI London 2019
data.description: Experts explore AI's most promising developments, emerging technologies, and profitable use cases.

data.title: When to trust AI
data.description: Marta Kwiatkowska provides an overview of techniques being developed to help improve the robustness, safety, and trust in AI systems.

data.description: Raffaello D’Andrea presents his vision of how autonomous indoor drones will drive the next wave of robotics development.

data.title: The quest for high-quality data
data.description: Ihab Ilyas describes the HoloClean framework, a prediction engine for structured data with direct applications in detecting and repairing data errors.

data.title: The AWS DeepRacer League and countdown to the re:Invent Championship Cup 2019
data.tags: Amazon Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, AWS DeepRacer
data.description: The AWS DeepRacer League is the world's first autonomous racing league, open to anyone. Announced at re:Invent 2018, it puts machine learning in the hands of every developer in a fun and exciting way. Throughout 2019, developers of all skill levels have competed in the League at 21 Amazon events globally, including Amazon re:MARS and select AWS Summits, and put their skills to the test in the League's virtual circuit via the AWS DeepRacer console. The League concludes at re:Invent 2019. Log in today and start racing—time is running out to win an expenses paid trip to re:Invent!

data.title: Calculating new stats in Major League Baseball with Amazon SageMaker
data.authors: Hussain Karimi, Travis Petersen (MLB), Priya Ponnapalli
data.tags: Amazon ML Solutions Lab, Amazon SageMaker, Artificial Intelligence, Sports
data.description: This post looks at the role machine learning plays in providing fans with deeper insights into the game. We also provide code snippets that show the training and deployment process behind these insights on Amazon SageMaker.

data.title: Information Gain and Mutual Information for Machine Learning
data.description: Information gain calculates the reduction in entropy or surprise from transforming a dataset in some way. It is commonly used in the construction of decision trees from a training dataset, by evaluating the information gain for each variable, and selecting the variable that maximizes the information gain, which in turn minimizes the entropy and best […]

data.title: Real-time AI for entity resolution
data.description: Jeff Jonas details how you can use a purpose-built real-time AI to gain new insights and make better decisions faster.

data.title: Restoring ancient text using deep learning: a case study on Greek epigraphy
data.description: This work presents PYTHIA, the first ancient text restoration model that recovers missing characters from a damaged text input using deep neural networks. Its architecture is carefully designed to handle longterm context information, and deal efficiently with missing or corrupted character and word representations.

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Information Entropy
data.description: Information theory is a subfield of mathematics concerned with transmitting data across a noisy channel. A cornerstone of information theory is the idea of quantifying how much information there is in a message. More generally, this can be used to quantify the information in an event and a random variable, called entropy, and is calculated […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Bayesian Belief Networks
data.description: Probabilistic models can define relationships between variables and be used to calculate probabilities. For example, fully conditional models may require an enormous amount of data to cover all possible cases, and probabilities may be intractable to calculate in practice. Simplifying assumptions such as the conditional independence of all random variables can be effective, such as […]
